elephant: Elephants trucks have 40,000 muscles and can delicately pick up a single blade of grass or rip branches off trees
Elephants are the largest land mammals on Earth.
Elephants are incredibly intelligent and can remember people, places, and experiences for many years — showing remarkable long-term memory.
Elephants drink over 200 liters of water a day and use their tusks to dig for water.
Elephants communicate with low-frequency sounds and vibrations that can travel miles.
octopus: Octopus have three hearts and blue blood
Under stress, octopuses sometimes detach an arm, which can keep moving for up to an hour.
giraffe: Giraffe sleep only a few minutes at a time (often totaling under 2 hours a day)
Giraffes are the tallest land animals in the world (14-19ft).
Giraffes spotted coat patterns are unique to each individual — like fingerprints.
Giraffes spots help with camouflage and act as thermal windows to help cool the body.
Giraffes use necking — neck-to-neck combat — to establish dominance.
dog: Dogs have an amazing sense of smell — much stronger than humans, which is why they are used in tracking and detection roles.
Dogs were one of the first animals domesticated by humans, living with people for thousands of years.
Dogs can hear sounds at frequencies far beyond human range, making their hearing extremely sensitive.
There are hundreds of dog breeds, each with unique traits and skills.
Some dogs can understand over 100 words and commands with proper training.
cat: Cats sleep a lot — about 70% of their lives — making them expert nappers!
Cats have 32 muscles that control their ears, allowing incredibly precise movement.
Cats can make over 100 different vocal sounds, while dogs make about 10.
A group of kittens is called a ‘kindle.’
Cats have whiskers on the backs of their front legs as well as their face!
lion: Lions are the only big cats that live in social groups, which are called prides.
A lion’s roar can be heard up to 5 miles (about 8 kilometers) away.
Female lions (lionesses) are the primary hunters in the pride.
Male lions’ manes vary in color and size, and darker manes are associated with stronger males.
Lions spend up to 20 hours a day resting.
tiger: Tigers are the largest members of the cat family.
Even if a tiger's fur is shaved, its skin retains the same striped pattern.
A tiger’s striped pattern is unique, like a human fingerprint.
Tigers mark territory using scent and scratch marks.
Tiger cubs learn to hunt by watching their mothers.
Tigers can swim well and often enjoy water — unlike many other cats.
